references: J.-M. De Koninck, Ces nombres qui nous fascinent, Entry 399, p. 89, Ellipses, Paris 2008.
links: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..250
Index entries for sequences related to Carmichael numbers.
formula: a(n) composite and squarefree, prime p | a(n) ==> p+n | a(n)+n
maple: with(numtheory); P:=proc(i) local d, k, n, ok, p; for k from 0 to i dofor n from 2 to i do if not isprime(n) then p:=ifactors(n)[2]; ok:=1;for d from 1 to nops(p) do if p[d][2]>1 then ok:=0; break; fi;if  not type((n+k)/(p[d][1]+k), integer) then ok:=0; break; fi; od;if ok=1 then print(n); break; fi; fi; od; od; end: P(10^9); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Aug 09 2013
author: _David W. Wilson_
